title: Tempe teen dies after accidental shooting, brother-in-law arrested
content:
TEMPE, Ariz. - A 16-year-old is dead after an accidental shooting Monday night, and her brother-in-law is behind bars in the incident, according to the Tempe Police Department.
Police said it happened in an apartment complex near Rural Road and University Drive.
Officers arrested Emmanuel Hilerio, 23. Police officials said though it was an accident, the reckless behavior landed Hilerio behind bars pending a manslaughter charge.
Police later identified the victim as Marlen Hernandez.
"She was pretty friendly," said her former classmate Eddie Bacon. "She would always say hit to me, every time I walked down the street, kind of start of a conversation or whatever."
Hernandez lived in Mexico with her parents, said police. She moved there with them about two years ago.
She was in Tempe visiting her sister and her sister's husband.
The investigation showed Hernandez was handling the gun at one point. The firearm accidentally discharged as Hilerio, the owner of the handgun, tried to take it back, police said.
"Manipulating the gun was reckless, and he understood the dangers of having a handgun," said Det. Lily Duran. "He feels horrible. He did not mean to do this."
Officers said the girl was transported to the trauma center with a gunshot wound to the head. She later died from her injuries.
